title: Newsletter 33:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Welcome 2020! Keith discusses New Year resolutions and how a positive attitude can make all the difference. The black sand of "Lake Kennecott" is covered and a New Year's Eve party photo from 1943 shows McGill residents ringing in the new year!
subject: Holidays;Kennecott Lake;McGill Club

title: Newsletter 34:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith analyzes an image of the McGill Pool area and homes for dairy workers. Present-day McGill experiences slightly warmer weather for January. Rudy pushes back the completion date of the IOOF and Mike Nass picks up a 2500 pound safe from Idaho for his collection. A 1907 image showing the excavation of the Reverb building is shown.
subject: Pools;Housing

title: Newsletter 35:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The first permanent houses to be built in McGill are depicted in an historic image. These were built on the circle . These structures were used as dormitories for the single men who worked in the office. Present-day McGill still experiences warmer weather with no snow. The IOOF Hall is under construction and is slightly behind schedule. A 1909 image of the town is included.
subject: Housing;Fraternal;Steptoe

title: Newsletter 36:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: An image from April 3, 1913 shows the slag from the smelter converters being dumped into the slag ditch. The result was a "black sand" shards that McGill kids learned to avoid. An old photo of railroad tracks is shown. Present-day McGill watches as a 720 ton piece of a nuclear reactor is driven through town on the way to its destination. An image of the mill fire cleanup from 1922 is included.
subject: Housing;Main Street;Documentaries;Pools

title: Newsletter 37:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A film crew arrives in McGill to film for a documentary on White Pine County. The Drug Store, McGill Club and other locals will be featured. Several McGill long-term residents were interviewed. When completed, the documentary will make its debut at an international film festival. Images of the McGill Drug Company and Campton Merc. are displayed as well as a McGill Grammar School commencement announcement from 1925.
subject: Drug Stores;Schools;Documentaries

title: Newsletter 38:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith shares memories about the O'Neil Service Station, owned by Ray and Mary O'Neill. Historical as well as current images of the service station are shown in the newsletter. Present-day McGill experiences a severe wind storm and Marie's Cafe sustains damage.
subject: Main Street;Businesses;Gas Stations

title: Newsletter 39:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith analyzes an image of Main Street showing the McGill Candy Store and other businesses. The images appear to be from the 1930's or 1940's. Also shown is the McGill Cleaner's building, the Victory Club and the Greek church. Present-day news shows the IOOF Hall construction coming along nicely.
subject: Main Street;Businesses;Gas Stations;Fraternal

title: Newsletter 40:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: On September 1, 1929, Ruth beats McGill Community League in baseball with a final score of 20-10. Present-day McGill prepares for the documentary. A 1960 images of Miss Nevada (Nancy Bowen), who happened to be from McGill.
subject: Documentaries;Baseball;Holidays;Sports

title: Newsletter 41:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Business Ads in McGill - Part I. The Brunswick Billiard Hall, McGill Club, McGill Laundry and Cononelo's Merchandise Store are shown in a vintage image from about 1926. In 2020, the theater remodel is moving forward. A 2909 image showing two men participating in the first 'badger fights' in front of the jeweler and Nye Bros. Outfitters.
subject: Main Street;Automobiles;People;Businesses;Theaters

title: Newsletter 42:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Business Ads in McGill - Part II. Bernstein's Clothes Shop is featured in an ad, as well as the McGill National Bank, McGill Tailoring and Athens Mercantile Co. Present-day shows the theater renovation is continuing with gusto. The McGill Drugstore ribbon-making machine is in full swing!
subject: Main Street;Automobiles;Businesses;Theaters

title: Newsletter 43:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith discusses rationing during WWII and compares to present-day recycling. Every resident (including children) were issued a war ration booklet containing stamps. Rudy continues to work on the theater renovation in present-day McGill and several images are included.
subject: WWII;Theaters;Businesses;Housing

title: Newsletter 44:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Images of the original 300 ft. stack are shown. The theater renovation is moving along nicely. Photos from 1935 show the elementary school playground. A great image of the Kennecott mine entrance from the 1950's is included.
subject: Smelters;People;Theaters;Kennecott;Schools

title: Newsletter 45:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Japanese girls perform a traditional dance on the McGill baseball infield. The image appears to be from the early 1900's, perhaps 1916. Many Japanese families lived in McGill in the early days. More images of the theater renovation are included. A 1908 images of the Ruth pit showing railroad tracks and a steam engine.
subject: Sports;Baseball;Churches;People;Theaters

title: Newsletter 46:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith includes several images of the McGill Baseball and Football teams from the early 1900's. The IOOF Hall renovation shows floor prepared for new sewer lines.
subject: Sports;Baseball;People;Football;Fraternal;Churches;Schools

title: Newsletter 47:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The McGill Post Office was established on the McGill ranch in the late 1800's. The newsletter shows a timeline from when the Post Office started on the ranch to when it moved to its location on Main Street. Several photos are included. The Covid scare affects McGill, but life goes on.
subject: Post Offices;Main Street;Bands

title: Newsletter 48:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Spring finally comes to McGill! Keith shares a story about the opening day of fishing in the 1940's. Work continues on the IOOF Hall renovation.
subject: Fraternal;Fishing;People

title: Newsletter 49:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of an old friend. Keith and his friend, Bonnie Mesic, prepare some food for a local wedding. Old mine images from afar.
subject: Kennecott;People

title: Newsletter 50:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Baseball was an important part of the culture in McGill. The youth idolized the players and their goal was to become one of them. After a lull, present-day McGill residents are working to restore the ballpark. Workers from the IOOF Hall restoration project uncover some relics from McGill's past. A 1911 photo of the new Pierce Smith converters is included.
subject: Baseball;Fraternal;Sports;Kennecott;Smelters

title: Newsletter 51:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A brief history of some of the Fraternal groups in McGill. The IOOF Hall was built in 1925-1926. The building housed the Oddfellows and the Knights of Pythias. A few images of the club members are included. The McGill Laundry and L.C. Company can be seen in the background. Artifacts discovered in the IOOF attic are shown. Vintage images (circa 1935) of the converter building are also included.
subject: Fraternal;Clubs;Smelters

title: Newsletter 52:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: This issue signifies the one-year anniversary of the McGill newsletters! McGill continues to change as old buildings are remodeled into new business ventures.
subject: Main Street;Businesses

title: Newsletter 53:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Master fisherman's secret technique. The IOOF remodel takes shape. Historic IOOF Hall images from 1929 are included.
subject: Fishing;Fraternal;People

title: Newsletter 54:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls Memorial Day traditions. Vintage Memorial Day photos from a past  parade. Present-day McGill soldiers through the Covid shutdown.
subject: Holidays;Parades

title: Newsletter 55:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A 1970's McGill 'crime' is revealed! 2020 McGill experiences high winds and the Covid shutdown continues, despite the small number of infections in the county.
subject: People;Railroads;Theaters

title: Newsletter 56:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A brief history of the "Marie's Cafe" building over the decades. The IOOF Hall gets a new front door!
subject: Businesses;Main Street;Housing

title: Newsletter 57:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls the summer of 1940. Present-day McGill sees new aluminum seats and paint at the ballpark!
subject: Sports;Trestles

title: Newsletter 58:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Images of the first badger fight in McGill, circa late 1940's or early 1950's. Present-day McGill is fairly quiet, with the exception of a chemical spill in front of the old bank.
subject: Main Street

title: Newsletter 59:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Scouting was a popular activity for the boys in McGill. Keith shares memories of his adventures with his scout troop. The IOOF Hall remodel is coming along nicely!
subject: IOOF;Scouting

title: Newsletter 60:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: An image from April 3, 1913 shows the slag from the smelter converters being dumped into the slag ditch. The result was a "black sand" shards that McGill kids learned to avoid. An old photo of railroad tracks is shown. Present-day McGill watches as a 720 ton piece of a nuclear reactor is driven through town on the way to its destination.
subject: Smelters;Railroads;Tragedies

title: Newsletter 61:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: An image from the first McGill "cultural center", aka Stone's Amusement Hall is shown. Keith recalls times when the days when the center was used for many different purposes. The 2020 theater remodel progresses with the pouring of a cement floor. An amazing image of the construction of Boulder Dam in the 1930's is included.
subject: People;Businesses;Sports

title: Newsletter 62:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: An interesting story about the life of A.E. Preston, McGill Bank's long time cashier who came to McGill in 1921. Shown are images of money that Mr. Preston signed. The IOOF Hall gets a new floor polishing. An old aerial photo of McGill is included.
subject: Banks;Businesses;IOOF;People

title: Newsletter 63:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: More about the McGill Bank. McGill's charter number was #9452 and can be seen on much of the old currency. The IOOF Hall's kitchen is framed
subject: Banks;IOOF

title: Newsletter 64:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: An article about the process of producing copper from copper ore. Considering the size of the equipment, it is amazing to think this was even possible back in the early 1900's. Several images of the converters are included. 2020 McGill is still burdened by Covid as well as increasing water/sewer rates. Lawns in front of homes are replaced by rock landscapes while outlying farms are green with hay.
subject: Kennecott;Smelters;People;Housing

title: Newsletter 65:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of early McGill (1930's-1950's) when life was much more simple. Milk was delivered to each home and straight cream could be ordered in smaller bottles. Images of milk and cream bottles are included. McGill had one dairy farm where the milk was produced. The building where the milk was bottled is still standing and is shown in a present-day image.
subject: Pools;Dairies

title: Newsletter 66:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Earl "Bud" Gibson is pictured in his McGill baseball uniform in 1921 and discussion on the movement of the Manning house in 1956. The Drug Store gets a new furnace room staircase! A vintage image of the Palace Meat Market is included.
subject: Sports;Baseball;People;Main Street;Businesses

title: Newsletter 67:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A vintage aerial image of McGill is included. Keith dates the image to 1940-1949. Present-day McGill is bathed in smoke from Western fires. A great vintage image (circa 1907) showing construction of the mine is included.
subject: Kennecott;Housing

title: Newsletter 68:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls memories of times gone by and lessons he learned from his great-grandfather. Present-day McGill cleans up after a downpour.
subject: People;Housing

title: Newsletter 69:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Various wildlife (some unwanted) make their way through the yards in McGill. A Yurt is briefly constructed between the IOOF Hall and Sheriff's office. A great image of the converter building and smokestack (1906-1908) is included.
subject: Wildlife;People;Kennecott

title: Newsletter 70:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: McGill's Own Navy. Keith recalls the Spane brothers, Bill and Bob, who both went on to graduate from the Naval Academy and had successful careers. Included in the newsletter are articles about the brothers' accomplishments. Present-day McGill gets a new fiber optic cable.
subject: People;Military

title: Newsletter 71:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of Joso "Pinky" Krmpotic, long-time McGill resident. Present-day McGill cools down and animal control gets busy.
subject: Railroads;People

title: Newsletter 72:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Safety tips from the Kennevadan. As time progressed, safety became more of a priority for Kennecott Copper Company. Present-day McGill is still affected by California wildfires. Included is an image of a party held at the McGill American Legion Dedication in 1938.
subject: Kennecott

title: Newsletter 73:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: In the late 1940's, the Steptoe Valley had its own hospital - the Steptoe Valley Hospital. One of the doctors during McGill's early days was Dr. William Ririe. Dr. Ririe not only made house calls for McGill's human population, but occasionally for the four-legged sort as well. Present-day McGill continues to see work performed on the IOOF Hall and theater.
subject: Steptoe;Hospitals;People

title: Newsletter 74:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Kennecott Copper Company was made possible largely due to the work of their talented engineers, with Buck Jones being the head engineer. Present-day McGill experiences an influx of RV snowbirds passing through to warmer climates. An image of the McGill football team of 1929 is included.
subject: Kennecott;Smelters;People;Football;Sports

title: Newsletter 75:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls old friends and good times in 1940's McGill. Present-day McGill experiences speeding cars. An old photo of the White Pine football champions of 1927..
subject: People;Football;Churches

title: Newsletter 76:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Images and discussion of the mill fire that occurred on July 9, 1922. Word has it that the fire was sparked by a welding incident. An image of the McGill Pool is included. Times have changed and now the pool is behind a chain-link fence.
subject: Tragedies;Kennecott;Pools

title: Newsletter 77:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls the Greek store in early McGill as well as the Brunswick Billiard Hall (circa 1928 or later). Other businesses in this newsletter include the McGill Candy Kitchen and Bernsteins. Present-day McGill is cooling down. An interesting image of an ore car being dumped is included.
subject: Main Street;Businesses

title: Newsletter 78:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith dates a vintage photo with the Standard Oil building in the background to the mid to late 1950's. Present-day McGill gets some snow!
subject: Railroads;Smelters

title: Newsletter 79:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A vintage photo from the late 1950's or early 1960's show Santa arriving in McGill on an old fire truck. A vintage photo of the McGill Baseball team is included.
subject: Gas Stations;Holidays;Baseball;Sports

title: Newsletter 80:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A McGill Community League by-laws document is found! Keith talks about the formation of the Community League and the founder, John Kinnear Sr. Keith's grandfather is shown with player Ed Pesout
subject: People;Baseball;Sports;Holidays

title: Newsletter 81:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: An interesting account of the formation of the Colgate-Palmolive-Peet corporation. The McGill Drug Store Museum opens from 11-4 on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Keith will be manning the operations. An image of the Club 50 dinner menu is included. Inflation has sure increased prices over the decades!
subject: Businesses;Drug Stores

title: Newsletter 82:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of Christmas past. In the early days of WWII, citizens were asked to salvage foil, string and scrap metal for use in the war effort. War bonds were issued as a way for the government to raise money. Present-day McGill begins to decorate for the Christmas season. The annual pole decorating contest in honor of Rose Papez, brings cheer to the town. Keith recalls the Christmas of 1941 as the last where toys were readily available.
subject: Holidays;People;Smelters;WWII

title: Newsletter 83:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls the Pearl Harbor attack and the effect it had on the town. Present-day McGill experiences the annual Christmas parade.
subject: Holidays;WWII;Parades

title: Newsletter 84:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith encourages everyone to have a MERRY CHRISTMAS! More memories of past Christmases and childhood fun. Memories of Don Reed, Keith's uncle.
subject: Holidays;People

title: Small child on car from about 1948 or 1949.
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A small child sits on the roof of a car. The photo is from approximately 1948 or 1949 based on the car. There is a piece of cardboard on the front of the car which shielded the radiator from the cold. The little girl is wearing a dress despite the cold weather.
subject: Children;Automobiles

title: The entrance to the Kennecott mine.
creator: Keith Gibson
description: This image of the mine entrance was taken from the plant side looking down toward the hospital.
subject: Kennecott;Automobiles

title: The construction of the smoke stack.
creator: Keith Gibson
description: This image shows the beginning of construction of the 300 ft smoke stack.
subject: Kennecott;Smoke Stacks;Horses;Men

title: McGill Cub Scouts
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A happy bunch of McGill Cub Scouts from about 1950.
subject: Scouting

title: A McGill Christmas Party at the Theater
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The town got together to celebrate Chrismas together.
subject: Holidays
